page.title: 03WETHERBY COUNCIL 1 structure
page.content: The Wetherby area is a Ward within Leeds City, which in turn is part of the West Yorkshire Metropolitan Authority. The council offices were built in 1936 and extended in 1966. There are 6 departments with a total workforce of 32; less than half of these live in Wetherby, the rest travel from nearby villages, Harrogate or Leeds. The busiest department is {Administration,}which is led by the Area Office Manager. It provides clerical and typing support for the other departments as well as manning the switchboard and reception. Rentals are also collected from the stall holders of Wetherby Market. The {Cleansing}department garages are on Hallfield Lane but an inspector calls at the main offices for reports and complaints.
